opening.context_answer: Stretching, consistent training, nutrition, and motivation all making everything feel easy

wins: Lots of stretching and increased flexibility
reflection.win_details: Multiple systems firing together - stretching routine, training consistency, nutrition tracking, stress management all aligned
reflection.main_barrier: Sleep issues (despite perceived improvement, WHOOP shows 5.8h avg)

wellbeing.injury_detail: Hamstring strain; potential pec weakness on right from aggressive bench progression (not a strain yet)

coach_summary.executive_summary: Strong subjective week (9/10 outlook, exceptional training quality) but WHOOP reveals underlying stress: 66% avg recovery with one 16% crash day. Two injury concerns (hamstring strain, pec weakness) combined with 5.8h sleep avg and 14.3 strain suggests riding momentum at the edge of overreaching. The stretching habit is paying dividends - keep it.

outlook_analysis.interpretation: Subjective ratings (9/10, physical 5/5, training 5/5) exceed objective WHOOP data (66% recovery, 5.8h sleep). This can indicate good mental state masking accumulating physical stress, or genuine adaptation capacity. Watch for delayed fatigue.

pattern_analysis.key_correlation: Dec 12 crash (16% recovery, 3.17h sleep, 15.7 strain) followed by strong rebound (94%, 8.52h sleep) - shows recovery capacity but also volatility risk

risk_flags: One severe recovery crash (16%) this week
Aggressive bench progression causing pec concern
High strain (14.3) maintained despite suboptimal recovery

forward_action_validation.suggestion: Training consistency is good for momentum, but consider: 1) Don't increase bench load until pec stabilizes, 2) Prioritize 7h+ sleep nights to prevent another crash day, 3) Hamstring rehab exercises pre-workout

recommendations: PROTECT SLEEP: Target 7h minimum - one more 3h night could tank the week
BENCH PROGRESSION: Hold weight, focus on control and pec engagement - no increases until right side feels solid
NUTRITION: 236g protein avg is excellent. Lower calorie days (Dec 11-13) correlate with recovery dip - maintain 3500+ on training days
HAMSTRING PROTOCOL: 5min dynamic stretching pre-workout, focused hamstring mobility daily
KEEP STRETCHING: This is clearly working - don't cut it even when busy
MONITOR RECOVERY: If WHOOP shows <50% two days in a row, consider a lighter session
questions_for_coach: What triggered the Dec 12 sleep crash (3.17h)? Late night, stress, or just schedule?
How long has hamstring strain been present? Getting better or static?
Current bench working weight and where did pec concern start?
coach_summary.accountability_reminder: Daily check-in reminder set - will ping each day

nutrition.notes: Full week of tracking. 236g protein avg - solid. Dec 11 lower calories (2117) aligns with WHOOP crash day.
